availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Wiley McQuinn (Breathitt County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. 5th Kentucky C.S.A.)

body.p: Breathitt County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Perry County, Kentucky, native. Married to Sarah W. "Sally" McQuinn. Father of Josephine McQuinn, Minerva McQuinn, Elmira McQuinn, Julian McQuinn, Nancy McQuinn, Armina McQuinn, and Vavena McQuinn. Farmer in Breathitt County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Breathitt County in 1860. Enlisted in the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a private on February 12, 1863. Enlisted in the 5th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a private on May 25, 1863. Captured in Magoffin County, Kentucky, on February 22, 1864. Suspected of guerrilla activity. Prisoner of war at Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, from March 6, 1864, to March 9, 1864. Prisoner of war at Camp Chase, Columbus, Franklin County, Ohio, from March 11, 1864, to May 8, 1865. Signed an oath of loyalty to the U.S. government on May 13, 1865.
